channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Massive explosion near Karachi airport leaves several injured
item.description: An explosion near Karachi Airport injured at least four people and caused significant damage. Believed to be caused by a tanker, the blast set vehicles on fire and led to road closures for investigation. Authorities are determining whether it was an accident or deliberate.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: FEMA administrator hits back at Trump’s 'ridiculous' claims on Biden's Hurricane Helene response
item.description: President Biden’s administration refutes former President Trump’s claims regarding Hurricane Helene recovery efforts. FEMA administrator assures sufficient resources, while Trump alleges funds diversion. DHS Secretary Mayorkas indicates adequacy for immediate needs but cautions on potential fund shortages for future storms.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It featured graphic nudity...': R-rated film played on Qantas flight with children onboard
item.description: A Qantas flight from Sydney to Tokyo accidentally played an explicit movie due to a technical glitch, leaving passengers, including families and children, in shock. The crew switched to a family-friendly film after nearly an hour. Qantas apologized and is reviewing its movie selection process to prevent similar incidents.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Meghan Markle advocates for children's healthcare in LA amid ‘professional separation’ from Prince Harry
item.description: Meghan Markle attended the LA Children’s Hospital Gala, highlighting the essential healthcare provided to underprivileged children. She praised the hospital staff for their dedication. This appearance comes amid reports of her and Prince Harry's professional separation and new twin-track approach to their careers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'We will win': Israeli PM Netanyahu meets army troops ahead of October 7 Hamas attack anniversary
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced that Israel's military actions have significantly changed the dynamics since the Hamas attack last year. Praising the army's efforts on the Lebanon border, he affirmed Israel's commitment to defeating enemies in Gaza and Lebanon, and preparing to target Iran. "Together, we will fight, and together we will win -- with God's help," he said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Laura Loomer calls Marjorie Taylor Greene a 'white trash embarrassment to MAGA'
item.description: Congresswoman Marjorie Taylor Greene faces criticism from within her party over comments minimizing human activity's role in climate change. Republican activist Laura Loomer questions Greene's competence, highlighting tensions among Trump supporters as the 2024 elections approach. The debate underscores a split in the party's message.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Diddy have a hand in Tupac’s murder? Crime scene investigator speaks out
item.description: Sheryl McCollum, a crime scene investigator, suggests Sean "Diddy" Combs could be linked to Tupac Shakur’s 1996 murder and a 1994 shooting. This theory gains traction as Shakur's family considers legal action against Combs, who faces unrelated charges of sex trafficking and racketeering.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Maldives President Muizzu begins first state visit to India, meets Jaishankar
item.dc:creator: Bandana Kanak

item.title: Elon Musk said 'I am Dark MAGA': What exactly is Dark MAGA?
item.description: Elon Musk recently attended a Donald Trump rally in Pennsylvania, identifying himself as 'Dark MAGA,' a term linked to far-right groups. Musk praised Trump while criticizing current President Biden. His support for Trump exemplifies his growing alignment with conservative politics, amplified through his social media platform, X.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel mass shooting: One dead, several injured in 'suspected terrorist attack' in Beersheba
item.description: A shooting at Beersheba's central station in southern Israel on Sunday resulted in one death and at least ten injuries. The attack, suspected to be terrorism and executed by a person reportedly associated with Bedouin from the Negev desert, follows a recent Hamas-claimed shooting in Tel Aviv and the ongoing ISrael-Hamas conflict since the October 7 attack last year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'unprecedented savegery': Prosecutor claims 15-year teenager stabbed 50 times and burned alive likely in drug-related attack
item.description: A 15-year-old boy was brutally murdered in Marseille amidst escalating drug-related violence. He was stabbed 50 times and burned alive by a rival gang. The city, gripped by a turf war, has seen 49 drug-related deaths this year, including 17 since January.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: TikTok star's last moments captured on camera
item.description: A 27-year-old Russian TikTok star, Arina Glazunova, died after falling in a Tbilisi subway underpass while filming a video. She tripped on a knee-high wall, resulting in fatal injuries. Locals criticized the lack of safety measures. Tbilisi’s City Hall stated the structure met Soviet-era standards. The incident has sparked widespread reactions on social media.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK PM says year of Israel-Hamas war hit community ties
item.description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer calls for a Gaza ceasefire and stresses the impact of the Israel-Hamas conflict on British community relations. He urges caution and mutual restraint, denouncing the rising hate against Jewish and Muslim communities in the UK while advocating unity and opposition to prejudice.

item.title: Wounded California officer fatally shoots man during 'unprovoked' knife attack
item.description: A California officer fatally shot a man who attacked him with a knife outside Santa Monica Police Department headquarters. The officer was wounded but expected to survive. The incident is under investigation by the Santa Monica Police Department and the Los Angeles County District Attorney's Office.

item.title: Hurricane Helene: US provides $100 million in emergency funds to North Carolina
item.description: North Carolina secures $100 million from the US Department of Transportation for immediate road and bridge repairs following Hurricane Helene's destruction. With severe flooding and multiple fatalities, prompt action is necessary. Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg highlights the urgency, while President Biden pledges federal support for debris removal and emergency costs, assuring continued aid for recovery.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US braces for another storm as tropical storm Milton threatens Florida's west coast
item.description: As Florida continues to recover from Hurricane Helene, Tropical Storm Milton has formed in the Gulf of Mexico, expected to intensify into a major hurricane. FEMA and state authorities are preparing for significant storm surge and heavy rainfall. Governor Ron DeSantis issued a state of emergency, urging residents to finalize preparedness plans and stay updated.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: End of France’s 31-year treasure hunt ‘On the Trail of the Golden Owl’
item.description: After 31 years, the iconic French treasure hunt, On the Trail of the Golden Owl, has concluded with the discovery of the hidden token. This long-standing quest attracted thousands of participants from around the world, all vying to solve the riddles and claim the valuable prize.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: International rescue teams arrive in Bosnia after devastating floods and landslides
item.description: Floods and landslides in Bosnia have left 18 dead and 10 missing, with areas like Donja Jablanica buried in rubble. Rescue teams from neighboring countries and the EU are aiding in relief efforts. The disaster has dominated national attention, overshadowing local elections and highlighting Bosnia's ongoing challenges with political and economic instability.

item.title: Pak: Protest in Awaran demands safe return of Diljan Baloch amid intimidation by security forces
item.description: A sit-in protest in Awaran, Balochistan, seeks the recovery of Diljan Baloch, who allegedly disappeared after being taken by Pakistan's security forces. Demonstrators, including women and children, face threats and intimidation from authorities but vow to continue until Diljan's safe return is secured.

item.title: Columbia University facing ‘donor crisis’ after anti-Israel protests on campus
item.description: Columbia University saw a 29% decline in 2024 donations after anti-Israel protests led to increased criticism of the university's management of demonstrations. Contributions dropped from 19,229 in 2022 to 13,870 in 2024, raising $21.4 million compared to $30 million in 2022.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
